description:
Tickets & Info: http://bit.ly/MML091716

Purchase your ticket(s), Invite your Girls, & Tag them in a post below for a chance to win free Magic Men merchandise and a VIP Meet & Greet with the Cast of the Show!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

AGE LIMIT: +18
DOOR TIME: 8PM
SHOW TIME: 9PM - 11PM

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

EXPERIENCE THE MAGIC... LIVE!

Introducing MAGIC MEN® LIVE! Experience ladies night like never before with a brand new, high energy, crowd interactive show that has captivated women of all ages! 

This high-energy and intensely exciting experience was designed with the desires of contemporary women in mind, young, old, single, married or girls just looking for something fun and new! Magic Men® Live features a talented cast of stunning guys sure to appeal to a variety of tastes. Dynamic productions of the hottest music and original compositions, thrilling choreographic displays and themed acts, Magic Men® Live invites ladies to let loose in an empowering, fun-filled environment and embark on an unforgettable night out!

PLEASE NOTE: Tickets for this event are very limited. It is highly recommended that you purchase your tickets early in advance to ensure entry. 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

Follow the "Magic Men" Online!
Facebook: Magic Men (www.facebook.com/MagicMenLive)
Twitter: @MagicMenLive (www.twitter.com/MagicMenLive)
Instagram: @MagicMenLive (www.instagram.com/MagicMenLive)
Snapchat: MagicMenLive
Website: www.MagicMenLive.com
name: MAGIC MEN® LIVE! - San Francisco, CA - Saturday, September 17th

name: Seoul Day in San Francisco

description:
Israeli mezzo-soprano Maya Lahyani takes the stage with LINES Ballet for a world premiere collaboration. Called a “resplendent” vocalist by the San Francisco Chronicle, Lahyani is a soloist with the Metropolitan Opera and recipient of the prestigious Adler Fellowship at San Francisco Opera. Lahyani and the dancers are joined by guest artist Meredith Webster, a beloved LINES Ballet company member for nearly a decade, who returns to share a new solo by Alonzo King.

The fall home season also heralds the revival of Meyer, featuring a score by acclaimed classical bassist Edgar Meyer. Meyer has been hailed by the New Yorker as “the most remarkable virtuoso in the relatively un-chronicled history of his instrument.” In response to Meyer’s signature combination of bluegrass, jazz, folk, and classical music, King’s choreography — originally created for the company’s 30th anniversary — is alternately wistful and jubilant, infused with a playful sense of wonder. Set before Academy Award-winning designer Jim Doyle’s striking backdrop of synchronized water, Meyer is a lushly-textured landscape of movement and sound.

Six performances only!
Wednesday, November 2 at 7:30pm	
Thursday, November 3 at 7:30pm*	
Friday, November 4 at 8pm
Saturday, November 5 at 8pm	
Sunday, November 6 at 2pm*
Sunday, November 6 at 6pm

*Post-performance talk with Alonzo King

Tickets start at $35 with a limited number of student tickets available for $25
(November 3 and 6, 2pm matinee performances only)
All tickets are subject to dynamic pricing based on demand.
Purchase early for best seats and prices.

--

Bank of the West is the 2016 Season Sponsor for Alonzo King LINES Ballet. Alonzo King LINES Ballet benefits from the support of Bank of the West for the development of its projects.

The world premiere with Maya Lahyani was made possible, in part, by the Lisa and John Pritzker Family Fund.

The creation of Meyer was made possible with the generous support of the National Endowment for the Arts, Lisa and John Pritzker Family Fund, and The Bernard Osher Foundation.

Photo: RJ Muna
location: Yerba Buena Center for the Arts
name: LINES Ballet Fall Home Season

description:
PUSHfest Dance Festival

PROGRAM A:
FRIDAY SEPT 23 | 8:00pm
SUNDAY SEPT 25 | 4:00pm

PROGRAM B:
SATURDAY SEPT 24 | 8:00pm
SUNDAY SEPT 25 | 7:00pm
________________________________

18 AMAZING & TALENTED CHOREOGRAPHERS
2 DIFFERENT & EXCITING PROGRAMS

PUSH Dance Company's mixed-genre dance festival PUSHfest returns for its third year with two must-see programs! This year's Festival brings together 18 choreographers, working in a wide range of styles, and includes three world premieres performed by PUSH Dance Company. 
_____________________________________________

FOR TICKETS:
visit: https://www.odcdance.org/performance.php?param=327
or call: 415-863-9834

$30 general admission, $28 in advance, $15 senior\student, $50 festival pass for both programs

LOCATION: 
ODC Theater
3153 17th St. SF, 94110

_____________________________

PROGRAM A features works by Mary Carbonara, Amy Foley, Joslynn Mathis Reed, Liv Schaffer, Mariah Steele, Shreelata Suresh, Alyssandra Katherine Wu and Raissa Simpson.

PROGRAM B features works by Todd Thomas Brown, Angela Dice Nguyen, Kameron Saunders, Casey Lee Thorne, Lalli Venkat, Vershawn Ward, Javan Wilson, Katerina Wong, and Ashley Gayle & Noah James
____________________________

PUSH in the MEDIA

“Ambitious”
The New Yorker

“Pushing the Standard”
SF Chronicle

“A surprise to watch”
SF Guardian

“Reflective Contemporary Choreography”
Dance Spirit Magazine

_____________________________

FUNDING CREDITS:

PUSH Dance Company is generously supported by the African American Theater Alliance for Independence (AATAIN) in association with the Hewlett Foundation, San Francisco Arts Commission, Grants for the Arts, Zellerbach Family Foundation and individual donors.

TO DONATE, visit: www.pushdance.org

_____________________________

FOR MORE ABOUT PUSHfest, visit: www.pushdance.org/festival
name: PUSHfest Dance Festival: Programs A & B

description:
"Dances Under the Crescent Moon 3"
-- a special evening of Women's Dance of the Orient

The ANAR DANA SF Bay Area Project presents dances spanning three continents, in the culmination of a 14-month intensive training project with internationally-acclaimed dance ethnologist Helene Eriksen.

Featuring dances by the
ANAR DANA SF Bay Area Project Ensemble from...

Algeria - Chaoui dance of the Aures Mountains
Egypt - Ghawazi dance of Upper Egypt
Romania - Manea dance of the Roma
Turkey - Black Sea Horon 
Daghestan - Tats dance from the Caucasus Mountains
Iran - Bandari from the Persian Gulf 
Turkmenistan - National Ensemble style  

PLUS

Solos by International Dance Artist
and Project Director,  Helene Eriksen 


Two Shows:

Saturday Nov. 12, 2016, 8pm
Sunday Nov. 13, 2016, 3pm

Mission Cultural Center for Latino Arts
2868 Mission Street, San Francisco CA 94110

$20 in advance /$25 at the door
location: Mission Cultural Center for Latino Arts
name: Dances Under the Crescent Moon 3

owner.name: ANAR DANA Bay Area with Helene Eriksen
